result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek Lamont Watkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Derek Lamont Watkins.  Attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Jury Trial. State prepared to proceed. Defense request an adjournment for reasons presented to the Court. Court GRANTED defense request. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Adjourn Trial, filed

Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Derek Lamont Watkins.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 15.

Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court sets dates as requested.  These hearings will be held in person in room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Calendar Call.  DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court cancelled stayed bench warrant. 
Discussion held to determine the posture of the case. Defense counsel in receipt of discovery, but no offer.
Court ordered this case adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Calendar call on June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for a Status Conference on 5-31-2022. Court was in trial.  Defendant failed to appear. 
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner and no action on bail and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.  Calendar call scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defendant appears without counsel and may qualify for spd appointment.
Court instructed defendant to contact to the Public Defender Office to be evaluated for appointment of counsel. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Derek Lamont Watkins in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek Lamont Watkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Derek Lamont Watkins
Current: 6744 N 77th St, Milwaukee, WI 53223 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: 725 South 24th Street, #1, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
